p-1: Default container and gutter for `-container-`, `-grid-`, `-gallery-`, `-liquid-2-`, `-liquid-3-`, `-metro-`, `-masonry-`.
Create a container to constrain your content. It can be pushed to the left, right edge or center aligned.
Create a responsive multi columns (and even multi rows) layout using `-grid-`.
p-2: You can change the column orders using `-(cols : order)-` format. Here the order works the same as flexbox-order works: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-flexbox-1/#order-property

scss: // orders: 1 0 0. The first div child will go last.

p-3: The child elements can be separated to multi rows using a nested list format: `-( (row1 row1 row1) (row2 row2) (row3 row3 row3))-`.
p-4: If the child elements are not `-div-`s, you need to proclaim it via `-child-` option in the format of `-child child-type-`.
p-5: Grid works with breakpoints to make multi layouts for different window size.

p-1: Make a fluid 2-columns blog layout, with a fixed sidebar and fluid main column.
p-2: The order and gutter can be redefined as well.

p-1: Make a holy-grail layout: 2 fixed sidebars with a fluid main column.
p-2: Order can be changed as well.

p-1: Make a photo gallery layout.
p-2: You can change the gutter and direction.
p-3: Use breakpoints to make it works on multi devices.

p-1: Make masonry layout with pure css.

p-1: Make a (Windows 8 style) metro layout.

scss: @include metro( (w5 w3 2 h2 w2 w4 of 5) gutter 10px);
// w5: 5 blocks width x 1 blocks height
// h2: 1 blocks width x 2 blocks height

p-1: Make diamond (octagon) shape layout. To reduce complexity, `-diamond-` requires `-.diamond-content-` to wrap its content.
Create `-angled-edges-` layout. `-background-` could be image, gradient or pure color, but the background of sibling elements must be pure color.
Create `-sticky-footer-` to prevent layout collapse when content is less, e.g. 404 page.
`-justify-` is for creating `-justify-` layout.
`-center-` is for creating both horizontal and vertical center aligned layout.
Pure css responsive charts. Currently only include `-bar-` and `-column-`, more types will be added soon.

scss: // animation: 0.6s ease (add class '.active' to charts to show animation)

p-1: Solutions for display a complex data table on small screen.

Referance: 
 http://dbushell.com/2012/01/05/responsive-tables-2/, 
 https://github.com/nadangergeo/RWD-Table-Patterns
responsive-table.capability: Flip-scroll: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 12.1+
Scroll: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 10.6+
Toggle: IE 8+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 5.1+, Opera 10.6+
Stack: IE 10+, Firefox 3.6+, Chrome 15+, Safari 4+, Opera 10.6+

scss: @include rp-table('stack' 'bp' 900 #dbdbdb 'data' ("First Name", "Last Name", "Job Title", "Favorite Color", "Wars or Trek?", "Porn Name", "Date of Birth", "Dream Vacation City", "GPA", "Arbitrary Data")) {

p-1: Pure css off-canvas with multiple modes.

markup: <!-- modes: slide-in, rotate-in, rotate-out, rotate-in-reverse, push, drawer -->
<!-- modes: slide-along, slide-out, scale-down, scale-up, open-door, reveal -->
<!-- 1. Add [data-has-submenu] to parent item, [data-submenu] to submenu. -->
<!-- 2. Place a checkbox and label before submenu, connect them by [for] and [id]. -->
scss: // mode: slide-in; (slide-in | slide-along | slide-out | rotate-in | rotate-out | rotate-in-reverse | scale-down | scale-up | open-door | push | reveal | drawer)
// you need set a dynamic gutter between the nav and the top edge of the window.
// The format is map: $keys => break points, values => gutters.
// You can use the keys form your $breakpoints.

p-1: Html5 form validation using H5F https://github.com/ryanseddon/H5F. We already include H5F in `-kit.js-` (with a little bit modification), so you don't need download it again.
Set your customized alerts information through `-<div data-info=""></div>-`.

p-1: `-media-list-` displays a media object (images, video, audio) to the left or right of a block object.

markup: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam animi tempore harum dignissimos error maxime, porro, quis dolorum laboriosam recusandae officia repudiandae natus mollitia id amet voluptatibus. Quibusdam, facilis! Hic.

p-1: `-type-` is a shorthand mixin for `-font-size-`, `-font-weight-`, `-font-style-`, `-line-height-`, `-font-family-`, `-text-align-`, `-text-transform-`.
syntax: // $font-weight: thin, hairline, 'extra light', 'ultra light', lighter, light, normal, medium, 'semi bold', 'demi bold', bold, bolder, 'extra bold', black, heavy, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, weight-normal, weight-inherit
// $text-transform: capitalize, uppercase, lowercase, none, full-width, transform-inherit
// to set 'font-weight', 'font-style', 'text-align' or 'text-transform' values to 'inherit' or 'normal',

p-1: Make `-font-size-` or other properties change smoothly depending on the window size.

Stolen from http://www.sassmeister.com/gist/7f22e44ace49b5124eec 
 More on https://blog.codepen.io/2016/10/31/fluid-type-blogs/.

`-type-` works with breakpoints. 
Everything you can do with `-type-` you can do with `-responsive-type-`.
Visually hide the text content of an element.
Set `-opacity-` property for IE8- and modern browsers.
Get `-rgba()-` color for IE8.

A shorthand @mixin for mediaquery. 
Note: `-ro-breakpoint-` uses one breakpoint (e.g. 800) for both `-min-` and `-max-` instead of two (e.g. 799 for `-max-`, 800 for `-min-`). If you don't want this behaiver, you can use `-$breakpoint-fix: false;-` to disable it.
Apply styles to child elements when they are equal to or more than a given amount.
Apply styles to child elements when they are equal to or less than a given amount.
Apply styles to child elements when they are equal to a given amount.
Apply styles to child elements when they are between 2 given amounts.
A shorthand @mixin for hide elements on some parts of viewport.

scss: // visible on 500px up on all media

p-1: A shorthand @mixin for hide elements on some parts of viewport.

scss: // hidden between 300px and 500px, and 700px up on screen

p-1: Get a light or dark color based on a given color.
By default, the light color is `-#fff-` and black color is `-#000-`, but you can use your own.

Get the complementary color based on a given color.
